intro: Monnina acutifolia, commonly known as prairie bluestem, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces seeds in small, capsule-like structures. Monnina acutifolia is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and thrive in harsh conditions.
